verses.roman:
saba deśa bhraṣṭa kaila ekalā nimāñi
brāhmaṇa mārite cāhe, dharma-bhaya nāi

synonyms: saba—all; deśa—countries; bhraṣṭa—spoiled; kaila—has; ekalā—alone; nimāñi—Nimāi Paṇḍita; brāhmaṇa—a caste brāhmaṇa; mārite—to strike; cāhe—He wants; dharma—of religious principles; bhaya—fear; nāi—there is not.
translation: "Nimāi Paṇḍita alone has spoiled the entire country," they accused. "He wants to strike a caste brāhmaṇa. He has no fear of religious principles.

purport.content: In those days also, the caste brāhmaṇas were very proud. They were not prepared to accept chastisement even from a teacher or spiritual master.
